Source Database Connection.name: Source Database Connection
Source Database Connection.description: The database where the source table resides

System feed category.name: System feed category
System feed category.description: System category of the feed this processor supports

System feed name.name: System feed name
System feed name.description: Name of feed this processor supports

Source Table.name: Source Table
Source Table.description: Name of table including schema (if applicable)

Source Fields.name: Source Fields
Source Fields.description: Field names (in order) to read from the source table. ie. the select fields. The format is separated by newline. Inconsistent order will cause corruption of the downstream Hive data.

Load Strategy.name: Load Strategy
Load Strategy.description: Whether to load the entire table or perform an incremental extract

High-Water Mark Property Name.name: High-Water Mark Property Name
High-Water Mark Property Name.description: Name of the flow file attribute that should contain the current hig-water mark date, and which this processor will update with new values.  Required if the load strategy is set to INCREMENTAL.

Date Field.name: Date Field
Date Field.description: Source field containing a modified date for tracking incremental load

Overlap Period.name: Overlap Period
Overlap Period.description: Amount of time to overlap into the last load date to ensure long running transactions missed by previous load weren't missed. Recommended: >0s

Max Wait Time.name: Max Wait Time
Max Wait Time.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query  , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.

Backoff Period.name: Backoff Period
Backoff Period.description: Only records older than the backoff period will be eligible for pickup. This can be used in the ILM use case to define a retention period. Recommended: >5m

Minimum Time Unit.name: Minimum Time Unit
Minimum Time Unit.description: The minimum unit of data eligible to load. For the ILM case, this would be DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.

Output Type.name: Output Type
Output Type.description: How should the results be returned.  Either a Delimited output such as CSV, or AVRO.  If delimited you must specify the delimiter.

Output Delimiter.name: Output Delimiter
Output Delimiter.description: Used only if the Output Type is 'Delimited'.  If this is empty and the Output Type is delimited it will default to a ','.  This property is not used if the Output Type is AVRO.

relationships.name: success
relationships.description: All files are routed to success

Input Directory.name: Input Directory
Input Directory.description: The input directory from which to pull files

File Filter.name: File Filter
File Filter.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up

Path Filter.name: Path Filter
Path Filter.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned

Batch Size.name: Batch Size
Batch Size.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration

Keep Source File.name: Keep Source File
Keep Source File.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes.  If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.

Recurse Subdirectories.name: Recurse Subdirectories
Recurse Subdirectories.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories

Polling Interval.name: Polling Interval
Polling Interval.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing

Ignore Hidden Files.name: Ignore Hidden Files
Ignore Hidden Files.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored

Minimum File Age.name: Minimum File Age
Minimum File Age.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

Maximum File Age.name: Maximum File Age
Maximum File Age.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

Minimum File Size.name: Minimum File Size
Minimum File Size.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled

Maximum File Size.name: Maximum File Size
Maximum File Size.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled

This property has been deprecated, and has no effect on processing. Relogins now occur automatically.

Additional Classpath Resources.name: Additional Classpath Resources
Additional Classpath Resources.description: A comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories that will be added to the classpath. When specifying a directory, all files with in the directory will be added to the classpath, but further sub-directories will not be included.

Directory.name: Directory
Directory.description: The HDFS directory from which files should be read

Recurse Subdirectories.name: Recurse Subdirectories
Recurse Subdirectories.description: Indicates whether to pull files from subdirectories of the HDFS directory

Keep Source File.name: Keep Source File
Keep Source File.description: Determines whether to delete the file from HDFS after it has been successfully transferred. If true, the file will be fetched repeatedly. This is intended for testing only.

File Filter Regex.name: File Filter Regex
File Filter Regex.description: A Java Regular Expression for filtering Filenames; if a filter is supplied then only files whose names match that Regular Expression will be fetched, otherwise all files will be fetched

Filter Match Name Only.name: Filter Match Name Only
Filter Match Name Only.description: If true then File Filter Regex will match on just the filename, otherwise subdirectory names will be included with filename in the regex comparison

Ignore Dotted Files.name: Ignore Dotted Files
Ignore Dotted Files.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored

Minimum File Age.name: Minimum File Age
Minimum File Age.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (based on last modification date) will be ignored

Maximum File Age.name: Maximum File Age
Maximum File Age.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (based on last modification date) will be ignored

Polling Interval.name: Polling Interval
Polling Interval.description: Indicates how long to wait between performing directory listings

Batch Size.name: Batch Size
Batch Size.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration, based on run schedule.

IO Buffer Size.name: IO Buffer Size
IO Buffer Size.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

relationships.name: Failure
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationships.name: No Retry
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes).  It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationships.name: Original
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.

relationships.name: Response
relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.

relationships.name: Retry
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.

HTTP Method.name: HTTP Method
HTTP Method.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported. Methods other than POST, PUT and PATCH will be sent without a message body.

Remote URL.name: Remote URL
Remote URL.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.

SSL Context Service.name: SSL Context Service
SSL Context Service.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections. It is also used to connect to HTTPS Proxy.

Connection Timeout.name: Connection Timeout
Connection Timeout.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.

Read Timeout.name: Read Timeout
Read Timeout.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.

Include Date Header.name: Include Date Header
Include Date Header.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.

Follow Redirects.name: Follow Redirects
Follow Redirects.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.

Attributes to Send.name: Attributes to Send
Attributes to Send.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.

Basic Authentication Username.name: Basic Authentication Username
Basic Authentication Username.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.  Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).

Basic Authentication Password.name: Basic Authentication Password
Basic Authentication Password.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.

Proxy Host.name: Proxy Host
Proxy Host.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

Proxy Port.name: Proxy Port
Proxy Port.description: The port of the proxy server

Proxy Type.name: Proxy Type
Proxy Type.description: The type of the proxy we are connecting to. Must be either http or https

invokehttp-proxy-user.name: invokehttp-proxy-user
invokehttp-proxy-user.description: Username to set when authenticating against proxy

invokehttp-proxy-password.name: invokehttp-proxy-password
invokehttp-proxy-password.description: Password to set when authenticating against proxy

Put Response Body In Attribute.name: Put Response Body In Attribute
Put Response Body In Attribute.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.

Max Length To Put In Attribute.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute
Max Length To Put In Attribute.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
Max Length To Put In Attribute.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.

Digest Authentication.name: Digest Authentication
Digest Authentication.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.

Always Output Response.name: Always Output Response
Always Output Response.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.

Trusted Hostname.name: Trusted Hostname
Trusted Hostname.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.

Add Response Headers to Request.name: Add Response Headers to Request
Add Response Headers to Request.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: The Content-Type to specify for when content is being transmitted through a PUT, POST or PATCH. In the case of an empty value after evaluating an expression language expression, Content-Type defaults to application/octet-stream

send-message-body.name: send-message-body
send-message-body.description: If true, sends the HTTP message body on POST/PUT/PATCH requests (default).  If false, suppresses the message body and content-type header for these requests.

Use Chunked Encoding.name: Use Chunked Encoding
Use Chunked Encoding.description: When POST'ing, PUT'ing or PATCH'ing content set this property to true in order to not pass the 'Content-length' header and instead send 'Transfer-Encoding' with a value of 'chunked'. This will enable the data transfer mechanism which was introduced in HTTP 1.1 to pass data of unknown lengths in chunks.

Penalize on \"No Retry\".name: Penalize on "No Retry"
Penalize on \"No Retry\".description: Enabling this property will penalize FlowFiles that are routed to the "No Retry" relationship.

use-etag.name: use-etag
use-etag.description: Enable HTTP entity tag (ETag) support for HTTP requests.

etag-max-cache-size.name: etag-max-cache-size
etag-max-cache-size.description: The maximum size that the ETag cache should be allowed to grow to. The default size is 10MB.

Database Connection Pooling Service.name: Database Connection Pooling Service
Database Connection Pooling Service.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database

Merge Strategy.name: Merge Strategy
Merge Strategy.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge. Valid values are SYNC,MERGE, PK_MERGE, DEDUPE_AND_MERGE, and ROLLING_SYNC.  Sync will completely overwrite the target table with the source data. Rolling Sync will overwrite target partitions only when present in source. Merge will append the data into the target partitions. Dedupe will insert into the target partition but ensure no duplicate rows are remaining. PK Merge will insert or update existing rows matching the same primary key.

Source schema.name: Source schema
Source schema.description: Name of the schema or database for the source table

Target schema.name: Target schema
Target schema.description: Name of the schema or database for the target table

Feed partition value.name: Feed partition value
Feed partition value.description: Feed timestamp that identifies the current feed partition

Partition Specification.name: Partition Specification
Partition Specification.description:
Partition specification in format: field|type|formula
field|type|formula

Field specification.name: Field specification
Field specification.description: Pipe-delim and newline for each field: column name|data type|comment|primary_key?|created_dt?|modified_dt?

Hive Configurations.name: Hive Configurations
Hive Configurations.description: Pipe separated list of Hive Configurations that you would like to set for Hive queries

Reset hive on connection.name: Reset hive on connection
Reset hive on connection.description: Upon getting a new connection it will call Hive 'reset' to reset hive settings back to the default.

blocking-id.name: blocking-id
blocking-id.description: A value, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the blocking key.  If more than 1 flowfile enter this processor with the same blocking key the flowfile will be penalized and routed to the 'blocked' relationship where it can retry if needed.

Hive Connection Pooling Service.name: Hive Connection Pooling Service
Hive Connection Pooling Service.description: If specified this connection pool will be used in place of the Thrift Service

Active Water Mark Strategy.name: Active Water Mark Strategy
Active Water Mark Strategy.description: Specifies what strategy should be followed when an attempt to obtain the latest high-water mark fails because another flow file is already actively using it

allowableValue.description: Yield the processor so that another attempt to obtain the high-water mark can be made later.

Penalize the flow file and return it to the queue that it came from so that another attempt to obtain the high-water mark can be made later.  Behaves the same as "Yield" if this processor is the first one in the flow.
Route immediately to the "activeFailure" relationship.

Max Yield Count Strategy.name: Max Yield Count Strategy
Max Yield Count Strategy.description: Specifies what strategy should be followed when the maximum yield count (if used) is reached

allowableValue.description: Routes the flow file to the "activeFailure" relationship

Cancels the actived water mark of any previous flow file, reactivates the water mark for the next flow file, and routes it to the "success" relationship.  Any in-flight flow file with pending commits will be ignored in favor of the newly routed flow file

Max Yield Count.name: Max Yield Count
Max Yield Count.description: The maximum number of yields/penalizations, if the yield strategy is selected, that should be attempted before failures to obtain a high-water mark are handled according to the "Max Yield Count Strategy" setting (handling never occurs if unset or less than zero)

Initial Value.name: Initial Value
Initial Value.description: The initial value for the water mark if none currently exists for the feed.

Attributes List.name: Attributes List
Attributes List.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.

Destination.name: Destination

Include Core Attributes.name: Include Core Attributes

Null Value.name: Null Value
Null Value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON

Store State.name: Store State
Store State.description: Select whether or not state will be stored. Selecting 'Stateless' will offer the default functionality of purely updating the attributes on a FlowFile in a stateless manner. Selecting a stateful option will not only store the attributes on the FlowFile but also in the Processors state. See the 'Stateful Usage' topic of the 'Additional Details' section of this processor's documentation for more information

Stateful Variables Initial Value.name: Stateful Variables Initial Value
Stateful Variables Initial Value.description: If using state to set/reference variables then this value is used to set the initial value of the stateful variable. This will only be used in the @OnScheduled method when state does not contain a value for the variable. This is required if running statefully but can be empty if needed.

Merge Strategy.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge. Valid values are SYNC,MERGE, PK_MERGE, DEDUPE_AND_MERGE, and ROLLING_SYNC.  Sync will completely overwrite the target table with the source data. Rolling Sync will overwrite target partitions only when present in source. Merge will append the data into the target partitions. Dedupe will insert into the target partition but ensure no duplicate rows are remaining. PK Merge will insert or update existing rows matching the same primary key.

relationships.name: merged
relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content

relationships.name: original
relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle

Merge Strategy.name: Merge Strategy
Merge Strategy.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles

allowableValue.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

Merge Format.name: Merge Format
Merge Format.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.

allowableValue.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile
The Avro contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

Attribute Strategy.name: Attribute Strategy
Attribute Strategy.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.

allowableValue.description: Any attribute that is not the same on all FlowFiles in a bin will be dropped. Those that are the same across all FlowFiles will be retained.

Any attribute that has the same value for all FlowFiles in a bin, or has no value for a FlowFile, will be kept. For example, if a bin consists of 3 FlowFiles and 2 of them have a value of 'hello' for the 'greeting' attribute and the third FlowFile has no 'greeting' attribute then the outbound FlowFile will get a 'greeting' attribute with the value 'hello'.

Correlation Attribute Name.name: Correlation Attribute Name
Correlation Attribute Name.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.

mergecontent-metadata-strategy.name: mergecontent-metadata-strategy
mergecontent-metadata-strategy.description: For FlowFiles whose input format supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), this property determines which metadata should be added to the bundle. If 'Use First Metadata' is selected, the metadata keys/values from the first FlowFile to be bundled will be used. If 'Keep Only Common Metadata' is selected, only the metadata that exists on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved. If 'Ignore Metadata' is selected, no metadata is transferred to the outgoing bundled FlowFile. If 'Do Not Merge Uncommon Metadata' is selected, any FlowFile whose metadata values do not match those of the first bundled FlowFile will not be merged.

allowableValue.description: For any input format that supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), the metadata for the first FlowFile in the bin will be set on the output FlowFile.

For any input format that supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), any FlowFile whose metadata values match those of the first FlowFile, any additional metadata will be dropped but the FlowFile will be merged. Any FlowFile whose metadata values do not match those of the first FlowFile in the bin will not be merged.
For any input format that supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), any FlowFile whose metadata values do not match those of the first FlowFile in the bin will not be merged.
Ignores (does not transfer, compare, etc.) any metadata from a FlowFile whose content supports embedded metadata.

Minimum Number of Entries.name: Minimum Number of Entries
Minimum Number of Entries.description: The minimum number of files to include in a bundle

Maximum Number of Entries.name: Maximum Number of Entries
Maximum Number of Entries.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle

Minimum Group Size.name: Minimum Group Size
Minimum Group Size.description: The minimum size of for the bundle

Maximum Group Size.name: Maximum Group Size
Maximum Group Size.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.

Max Bin Age.name: Max Bin Age
Max Bin Age.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours

Maximum number of Bins.name: Maximum number of Bins
Maximum number of Bins.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time

Delimiter Strategy.name: Delimiter Strategy
Delimiter Strategy.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.

allowableValue.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

Header File.name: Header File
Header File.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.

Footer File.name: Footer File
Footer File.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.

Demarcator File.name: Demarcator File
Demarcator File.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.

Compression Level.name: Compression Level
Compression Level.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored

Keep Path.name: Keep Path
Keep Path.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored

Tar Modified Time.name: Tar Modified Time
Tar Modified Time.description: If using the Tar Merge Format, specifies if the Tar entry should store the modified timestamp either by expression (e.g. ${file.lastModifiedTime} or static value, both of which must match the ISO8601 format 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ'; if using other merge strategy or left blank, this value is ignored

Ignore Dotted Files.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored

Delete Original.name: Delete Original
Delete Original.description: Determines whether or not the file is deleted from the remote system after it has been successfully transferred

Connection Timeout.name: Connection Timeout
Connection Timeout.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

Data Timeout.name: Data Timeout
Data Timeout.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

Host Key File.name: Host Key File
Host Key File.description: If supplied, the given file will be used as the Host Key; otherwise, no use host key file will be used

Max Selects.name: Max Selects
Max Selects.description: The maximum number of files to pull in a single connection

Remote Poll Batch Size.name: Remote Poll Batch Size
Remote Poll Batch Size.description: The value specifies how many file paths to find in a given directory on the remote system when doing a file listing. This value in general should not need to be modified but when polling against a remote system with a tremendous number of files this value can be critical.  Setting this value too high can result very poor performance and setting it too low can cause the flow to be slower than normal.

Strict Host Key Checking.name: Strict Host Key Checking
Strict Host Key Checking.description: Indicates whether or not strict enforcement of hosts keys should be applied

Send Keep Alive On Timeout.name: Send Keep Alive On Timeout
Send Keep Alive On Timeout.description: Indicates whether or not to send a single Keep Alive message when SSH socket times out

Use Compression.name: Use Compression
Use Compression.description: Indicates whether or not ZLIB compression should be used when transferring files

Use Natural Ordering.name: Use Natural Ordering
Use Natural Ordering.description: If true, will pull files in the order in which they are naturally listed; otherwise, the order in which the files will be pulled is not defined

Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin.

This property has been deprecated, and has no effect on processing. Relogins now occur automatically.

Additional Classpath Resources.name: Additional Classpath Resources
Additional Classpath Resources.description: A comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories that will be added to the classpath. When specifying a directory, all files with in the directory will be added to the classpath, but further sub-directories will not be included.

Directory.name: Directory
Directory.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written. The directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

allowableValue.description: Replaces the existing file if any.
Ignores the flow file and routes it to success.
Penalizes the flow file and routes it to failure.
Appends to the existing file if any, creates a new file otherwise.

Block Size.name: Block Size
Block Size.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

IO Buffer Size.name: IO Buffer Size
IO Buffer Size.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

Replication.name: Replication
Replication.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

Permissions umask.name: Permissions umask
Permissions umask.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode

Remote Owner.name: Remote Owner
Remote Owner.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner

Remote Group.name: Remote Group
Remote Group.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group

allowableValue.description: No compression
Default ZLIB compression
BZIP compression
GZIP compression
LZ4 compression
LZO compression - it assumes LD_LIBRARY_PATH has been set and jar is available
Snappy compression
Will attempt to automatically detect the compression codec.

container-name.description: Name of the Azure storage container

storage-sas-token.name: storage-sas-token
storage-sas-token.description: Shared Access Signature token, including the leading '?'. Specify either SAS Token (recommended) or Account Key. There are certain risks in allowing the SAS token to be stored as a flowfile attribute. While it does provide for a more flexible flow by allowing the account name to be fetched dynamically from a flowfile attribute, care must be taken to restrict access to the event provenance data (e.g. by strictly controlling the policies governing provenance for this Processor). In addition, the provenance repositories may be put on encrypted disk partitions.

storage-account-name.name: storage-account-name
storage-account-name.description: The storage account name.  There are certain risks in allowing the account name to be stored as a flowfile attribute. While it does provide for a more flexible flow by allowing the account name to be fetched dynamically from a flowfile attribute, care must be taken to restrict access to the event provenance data (e.g. by strictly controlling the policies governing provenance for this Processor). In addition, the provenance repositories may be put on encrypted disk partitions.

storage-account-key.name: storage-account-key
storage-account-key.description: The storage account key. This is an admin-like password providing access to every container in this account. It is recommended one uses Shared Access Signature (SAS) token instead for fine-grained control with policies. There are certain risks in allowing the account key to be stored as a flowfile attribute. While it does provide for a more flexible flow by allowing the account key to be fetched dynamically from a flow file attribute, care must be taken to restrict access to the event provenance data (e.g. by strictly controlling the policies governing provenance for this Processor). In addition, the provenance repositories may be put on encrypted disk partitions.

Selecting a stateful option will not only store the attributes on the FlowFile but also in the Processors state. See the 'Stateful Usage' topic of the 'Additional Details' section of this processor's documentation for more information

Stateful Variables Initial Value.description: If using state to set/reference variables then this value is used to set the initial value of the stateful variable. This will only be used in the @OnScheduled method when state does not contain a value for the variable. This is required if running statefully but can be empty if needed.

Database Connection Pooling Service.name: Database Connection Pooling Service
Database Connection Pooling Service.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database

Merge Strategy.name: Merge Strategy
Merge Strategy.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge. Valid values are SYNC,MERGE, PK_MERGE, DEDUPE_AND_MERGE, and ROLLING_SYNC.  Sync will completely overwrite the target table with the source data. Rolling Sync will overwrite target partitions only when present in source. Merge will append the data into the target partitions. Dedupe will insert into the target partition but ensure no duplicate rows are remaining. PK Merge will insert or update existing rows matching the same primary key.

Source schema.description: Name of the schema or database for the source table

Reset hive on connection.description: Upon getting a new connection it will call Hive 'reset' to reset hive settings back to the default.

blocking-id.description: A value, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the blocking key.  If more than 1 flowfile enter this processor with the same blocking key the flowfile will be penalized and routed to the 'blocked' relationship where it can retry if needed.

Solr Socket Timeout.description: The amount of time to wait for data on a socket connection to Solr. A value of 0 indicates an infinite timeout.

Solr Connection Timeout.name: Solr Connection Timeout
Solr Connection Timeout.description: The amount of time to wait when establishing a connection to Solr. A value of 0 indicates an infinite timeout.

Solr Maximum Connections.name: Solr Maximum Connections
Solr Maximum Connections.description: The maximum number of total connections allowed from the Solr client to Solr.

Solr Maximum Connections Per Host.name: Solr Maximum Connections Per Host
Solr Maximum Connections Per Host.description: The maximum number of connections allowed from the Solr client to a single Solr host.

ZooKeeper Connection Timeout.name: ZooKeeper Connection Timeout
ZooKeeper Connection Timeout.description: The amount of time to wait when establishing a connection to ZooKeeper, only used with a Solr Type of Cloud.

Delete Attributes Expression.name: Delete Attributes Expression
Delete Attributes Expression.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from FlowFiles.  Existing attributes that match will be deleted regardless of whether they are updated by this processor.

Store State.name: Store State
Store State.description: Select whether or not state will be stored. Selecting 'Stateless' will offer the default functionality of purely updating the attributes on a FlowFile in a stateless manner. Selecting a stateful option will not only store the attributes on the FlowFile but also in the Processors state. See the 'Stateful Usage' topic of the 'Additional Details' section of this processor's documentation for more information

Stateful Variables Initial Value.name: Stateful Variables Initial Value
Stateful Variables Initial Value.description: If using state to set/reference variables then this value is used to set the initial value of the stateful variable. This will only be used in the @OnScheduled method when state does not contain a value for the variable. This is required if running statefully but can be empty if needed.

relationships.name: Success
relationships.description: Relationship followed on successful precondition event.

Feed Cleanup Event Service.name: Feed Cleanup Event Service
Feed Cleanup Event Service.description: Service that manages the cleanup of feeds.

Metadata Provider Service.name: Metadata Provider Service
Metadata Provider Service.description: Service supplying the implementations of the various metadata providers.

System feed category.name: System feed category
System feed category.description: The category name of this feed. The default is to have this name automatically set when the feed is created. Normally you do not need to change the default value.

System feed name.name: System feed name
System feed name.description: The system name of this feed. The default is to have this name automatically set when the feed is created. Normally you do not need to change the default value.

relationships.name: set state fail
relationships.description: A failure to set the state after adding the attributes to the FlowFile will route the FlowFile here.

relationships.name: success
relationships.description: All successful FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

Delete Attributes Expression.name: Delete Attributes Expression
Delete Attributes Expression.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from FlowFiles.  Existing attributes that match will be deleted regardless of whether they are updated by this processor.

Store State.name: Store State
Store State.description: Select whether or not state will be stored. Selecting 'Stateless' will offer the default functionality of purely updating the attributes on a FlowFile in a stateless manner. Selecting a stateful option will not only store the attributes on the FlowFile but also in the Processors state. See the 'Stateful Usage' topic of the 'Additional Details' section of this processor's documentation for more information

Stateful Variables Initial Value.name: Stateful Variables Initial Value
Stateful Variables Initial Value.description: If using state to set/reference variables then this value is used to set the initial value of the stateful variable. This will only be used in the @OnScheduled method when state does not contain a value for the variable. This is required if running statefully but can be empty if needed.

relationships.name: Failure
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationships.name: No Retry
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes).  It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationships.name: Original
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.

relationships.name: Response
relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.

relationships.name: Retry
relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.

HTTP Method.name: HTTP Method
HTTP Method.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported. Methods other than POST, PUT and PATCH will be sent without a message body.

Remote URL.name: Remote URL
Remote URL.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.

SSL Context Service.name: SSL Context Service
SSL Context Service.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections. It is also used to connect to HTTPS Proxy.

Connection Timeout.name: Connection Timeout
Connection Timeout.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.

Read Timeout.name: Read Timeout
Read Timeout.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.

Include Date Header.name: Include Date Header
Include Date Header.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.

Follow Redirects.name: Follow Redirects
Follow Redirects.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.

Attributes to Send.name: Attributes to Send
Attributes to Send.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.

Basic Authentication Username.name: Basic Authentication Username
Basic Authentication Username.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.  Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).

Basic Authentication Password.name: Basic Authentication Password
Basic Authentication Password.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.

Proxy Host.name: Proxy Host
Proxy Host.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

Proxy Port.name: Proxy Port
Proxy Port.description: The port of the proxy server

Proxy Type.name: Proxy Type
Proxy Type.description: The type of the proxy we are connecting to. Must be either http or https

invokehttp-proxy-user.name: invokehttp-proxy-user
invokehttp-proxy-user.description: Username to set when authenticating against proxy

invokehttp-proxy-password.name: invokehttp-proxy-password
invokehttp-proxy-password.description: Password to set when authenticating against proxy

Put Response Body In Attribute.name: Put Response Body In Attribute
Put Response Body In Attribute.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.

Max Length To Put In Attribute.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute
Max Length To Put In Attribute.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
Max Length To Put In Attribute.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.

Digest Authentication.name: Digest Authentication
Digest Authentication.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.

Always Output Response.name: Always Output Response
Always Output Response.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.

Trusted Hostname.name: Trusted Hostname
Trusted Hostname.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.

Add Response Headers to Request.name: Add Response Headers to Request
Add Response Headers to Request.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: The Content-Type to specify for when content is being transmitted through a PUT, POST or PATCH. In the case of an empty value after evaluating an expression language expression, Content-Type defaults to application/octet-stream

send-message-body.name: send-message-body
send-message-body.description: If true, sends the HTTP message body on POST/PUT/PATCH requests (default).  If false, suppresses the message body and content-type header for these requests.

Use Chunked Encoding.name: Use Chunked Encoding
Use Chunked Encoding.description: When POST'ing, PUT'ing or PATCH'ing content set this property to true in order to not pass the 'Content-length' header and instead send 'Transfer-Encoding' with a value of 'chunked'. This will enable the data transfer mechanism which was introduced in HTTP 1.1 to pass data of unknown lengths in chunks.

Penalize on \"No Retry\".name: Penalize on "No Retry"
Penalize on \"No Retry\".description: Enabling this property will penalize FlowFiles that are routed to the "No Retry" relationship.

use-etag.name: use-etag
use-etag.description: Enable HTTP entity tag (ETag) support for HTTP requests.

etag-max-cache-size.name: etag-max-cache-size
etag-max-cache-size.description: The maximum size that the ETag cache should be allowed to grow to. The default size is 10MB.

High-Water Mark.description: The name to be given to this high-water mark, stored in the feed's metadata, which records the latest committed water mark value

High-Water Mark Value Property Name.name: High-Water Mark Value Property Name
High-Water Mark Value Property Name.description: Name of the flow file property which is set to the current high-water mark value for use in subsequent processing and commit

Release All.description: If true, commits or rolls back all pending high-water marks.  Otherwise, commits/rolls back only the named water mark property.

Database Connection Pooling Service.name: Database Connection Pooling Service
Database Connection Pooling Service.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database

System feed category.name: System feed category
System feed category.description: System category of the feed this processor supports

System feed name.name: System feed name
System feed name.description: Name of feed this processor supports

Table Type.name: Table Type
Table Type.description: Specifies the standard table type to create or ALL for standard set.

Field specification.name: Field specification
Field specification.description: Pipe-delim and newline for each field: column name|data type|comment|primary_key?|created_dt?|modified_dt?

Partition specification.name: Partition specification
Partition specification.description: Provide list of partition columns column-delimited

Feed Field specification.name: Feed Field specification
Feed Field specification.description: Pipe-delim and newline for each field: column name|data type|comment

Feed Table Storage Format.name: Feed Table Storage Format
Feed Table Storage Format.description: Provide format and delimiter specification. This is the full clause starting with the INPUTFORMAT such as: INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TextInputFormat' OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.HiveIgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat'

Target Table Format.name: Target Table Format
Target Table Format.description: Provide storage format specification for the target tables

Target Table Properties.name: Target Table Properties
Target Table Properties.description: TblProperties clause generally specifying the compression option

Feed Table Properties.name: Feed Table Properties
Feed Table Properties.description: TblProperties clause for feed table serde

Feed Root Path.name: Feed Root Path
Feed Root Path.description: Specify the full HDFS or S3 root path for the feed,valid,invalid tables.

Profile Root Path.name: Profile Root Path
Profile Root Path.description: Specify the HDFS or S3 folder root path for creating the profile table

Master Root Path.name: Master Root Path
Master Root Path.description: Specify the HDFS or S3 folder root path for creating the master table

Feed Table Override.name: Feed Table Override
Feed Table Override.description: Executes the provided DDL for the feed table create instead of the default behavior.

Initialization Failure Strategy.name: Initialization Failure Strategy
Initialization Failure Strategy.description: Indicates how this processor should behave when a flow file arrives after feed initialization has failed.

allowableValue.description: Immediately fail the flow file
Retry initialization (if the appropriate time delay has expired) and penalize the flow file.

Initialization Retry Delay (seconds).name: Initialization Retry Delay (seconds)
Initialization Retry Delay (seconds).description: The minimum amount of seconds to delay before an arriving flow file should trigger another attempt to initialize a feed that has previously failed initialization.  Any flow file arriving before this delay has expired will be immediately failed.

Max Initialization Attempts.name: Max Initialization Attempts
Max Initialization Attempts.description: The maximum number of times initialization will be retried where there are failures.  There is no limit if unset.

Clone initialization flowfile.name: Clone initialization flowfile
Clone initialization flowfile.description: Indicates whether the feed initialization flow will use a flowfile that is a clone of the input flowfile, i.e. includes all content.

Max Flow File Count.name: Max Flow File Count
Max Flow File Count.description: The maximum number of flow files to process at one time

Max Flow Files size.name: Max Flow Files size
Max Flow Files size.description: The maximum accumulated flow file sizes (in kilobytes) to process at one time

relationships.name: failure
relationships.description: Failed to convert attributes to JSON

relationships.name: success
relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON

Attributes List.name: Attributes List
Attributes List.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.

attributes-to-json-regex.name: attributes-to-json-regex
attributes-to-json-regex.description: Regular expression that will be evaluated against the flow file attributes to select the matching attributes. This property can be used in combination with the attributes list property.

Destination.name: Destination
Destination.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.

Include Core Attributes.name: Include Core Attributes
Include Core Attributes.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.

Null Value.name: Null Value
Null Value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON

Hostname.name: Hostname
Hostname.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the remote system

Port.name: Port
Port.description: The port that the remote system is listening on for file transfers

Remote Path.name: Remote Path
Remote Path.description: The path on the remote system from which to pull or push files

File Filter Regex.name: File Filter Regex
File Filter Regex.description: Provides a Java Regular Expression for filtering Filenames; if a filter is supplied, only files whose names match that Regular Expression will be fetched

Path Filter Regex.name: Path Filter Regex
Path Filter Regex.description: When Search Recursively is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given Regular Expression will be scanned

Polling Interval.name: Polling Interval
Polling Interval.description: Determines how long to wait between fetching the listing for new files

Search Recursively.name: Search Recursively
Search Recursively.description: If true, will pull files from arbitrarily nested subdirectories; otherwise, will not traverse subdirectories

Ignore Dotted Files.name: Ignore Dotted Files
Ignore Dotted Files.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored

Delete Original.name: Delete Original
Delete Original.description: Determines whether or not the file is deleted from the remote system after it has been successfully transferred

Connection Timeout.name: Connection Timeout
Connection Timeout.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

Data Timeout.name: Data Timeout
Data Timeout.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

Max Selects.name: Max Selects
Max Selects.description: The maximum number of files to pull in a single connection

Remote Poll Batch Size.name: Remote Poll Batch Size
Remote Poll Batch Size.description: The value specifies how many file paths to find in a given directory on the remote system when doing a file listing. This value in general should not need to be modified but when polling against a remote system with a tremendous number of files this value can be critical.  Setting this value too high can result very poor performance and setting it too low can cause the flow to be slower than normal.

Use Natural Ordering.name: Use Natural Ordering
Use Natural Ordering.description: If true, will pull files in the order in which they are naturally listed; otherwise, the order in which the files will be pulled is not defined

Proxy Type.name: Proxy Type
Proxy Type.description: Proxy type used for file transfers

Proxy Host.name: Proxy Host
Proxy Host.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

Proxy Port.name: Proxy Port
Proxy Port.description: The port of the proxy server

Internal Buffer Size.name: Internal Buffer Size
Internal Buffer Size.description: Set the internal buffer size for buffered data streams

ftp-use-utf8.name: ftp-use-utf8
ftp-use-utf8.description: Tells the client to use UTF-8 encoding when processing files and filenames. If set to true, the server must also support UTF-8 encoding.

Source Table.name: Source Table
Source Table.description: Name of table including schema (if applicable)

Source Fields.name: Source Fields
Source Fields.description: Field names (in order) to read from the source table. ie. the select fields. The format is separated by newline. Inconsistent order will cause corruption of the downstream Hive data.

Load Strategy.name: Load Strategy
Load Strategy.description: Whether to load the entire table or perform an incremental extract

High-Water Mark Property Name.name: High-Water Mark Property Name
High-Water Mark Property Name.description: Name of the flow file attribute that should contain the current hig-water mark date, and which this processor will update with new values.  Required if the load strategy is set to INCREMENTAL.

Date Field.name: Date Field
Date Field.description: Source field containing a modified date for tracking incremental load

Overlap Period.name: Overlap Period
Overlap Period.description: Amount of time to overlap into the last load date to ensure long running transactions missed by previous load weren't missed. Recommended: >0s

Max Wait Time.name: Max Wait Time
Max Wait Time.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query  , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.

Backoff Period.name: Backoff Period
Backoff Period.description: Only records older than the backoff period will be eligible for pickup. This can be used in the ILM use case to define a retention period. Recommended: >5m

Minimum Time Unit.name: Minimum Time Unit
Minimum Time Unit.description: The minimum unit of data eligible to load. For the ILM case, this would be DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.

Output Type.name: Output Type
Output Type.description: How should the results be returned.  Either a Delimited output such as CSV, or AVRO.  If delimited you must specify the delimiter.

Output Delimiter.name: Output Delimiter
Output Delimiter.description: Used only if the Output Type is 'Delimited'.  If this is empty and the Output Type is delimited it will default to a ','.  This property is not used if the Output Type is AVRO.

Hostname.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the remote system

Private Key Path.name: Private Key Path
Private Key Path.description: The fully qualified path to the Private Key file

Remote Path.name: Remote Path
Remote Path.description: The path on the remote system from which to pull or push files

File Filter Regex.name: File Filter Regex
File Filter Regex.description: Provides a Java Regular Expression for filtering Filenames; if a filter is supplied, only files whose names match that Regular Expression will be fetched

Path Filter Regex.name: Path Filter Regex
Path Filter Regex.description: When Search Recursively is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given Regular Expression will be scanned

Polling Interval.name: Polling Interval
Polling Interval.description: Determines how long to wait between fetching the listing for new files

Search Recursively.name: Search Recursively
Search Recursively.description: If true, will pull files from arbitrarily nested subdirectories; otherwise, will not traverse subdirectories

Ignore Dotted Files.name: Ignore Dotted Files
Ignore Dotted Files.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored

Delete Original.name: Delete Original
Delete Original.description: Determines whether or not the file is deleted from the remote system after it has been successfully transferred

Connection Timeout.name: Connection Timeout
Connection Timeout.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

Data Timeout.name: Data Timeout
Data Timeout.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

Host Key File.name: Host Key File
Host Key File.description: If supplied, the given file will be used as the Host Key; otherwise, no use host key file will be used

Max Selects.name: Max Selects
Max Selects.description: The maximum number of files to pull in a single connection

Remote Poll Batch Size.name: Remote Poll Batch Size
Remote Poll Batch Size.description: The value specifies how many file paths to find in a given directory on the remote system when doing a file listing. This value in general should not need to be modified but when polling against a remote system with a tremendous number of files this value can be critical.  Setting this value too high can result very poor performance and setting it too low can cause the flow to be slower than normal.

Strict Host Key Checking.name: Strict Host Key Checking
Strict Host Key Checking.description: Indicates whether or not strict enforcement of hosts keys should be applied

Send Keep Alive On Timeout.name: Send Keep Alive On Timeout
Send Keep Alive On Timeout.description: Indicates whether or not to send a single Keep Alive message when SSH socket times out

Use Compression.name: Use Compression
Use Compression.description: Indicates whether or not ZLIB compression should be used when transferring files

Use Natural Ordering.name: Use Natural Ordering
Use Natural Ordering.description: If true, will pull files in the order in which they are naturally listed; otherwise, the order in which the files will be pulled is not defined

Hadoop Configuration Resources.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources
Hadoop Configuration Resources.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration. To use swebhdfs, see 'Additional Details' section of PutHDFS's documentation.

kerberos-credentials-service.description: Specifies the Kerberos Credentials Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

Kerberos Principal.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties

Kerberos Keytab.name: Kerberos Keytab
Kerberos Keytab.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties

Kerberos Relogin Period.name: Kerberos Relogin Period
Kerberos Relogin Period.description:
Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin.

This property has been deprecated, and has no effect on processing. Relogins now occur automatically.

Additional Classpath Resources.name: Additional Classpath Resources
Additional Classpath Resources.description: A comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories that will be added to the classpath. When specifying a directory, all files with in the directory will be added to the classpath, but further sub-directories will not be included.

Directory.name: Directory
Directory.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written. The directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

Conflict Resolution Strategy.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy
Conflict Resolution Strategy.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory

allowableValue.description: Replaces the existing file if any.
Ignores the flow file and routes it to success.
Penalizes the flow file and routes it to failure.
Appends to the existing file if any, creates a new file otherwise.

Block Size.name: Block Size
Block Size.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

IO Buffer Size.name: IO Buffer Size
IO Buffer Size.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

Replication.name: Replication
Replication.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration

Permissions umask.name: Permissions umask
Permissions umask.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode

Remote Owner.name: Remote Owner
Remote Owner.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner

Remote Group.name: Remote Group
Remote Group.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group

allowableValue.description: No compression
Default ZLIB compression
BZIP compression

LZ4 compression

Snappy compression

Permissions.name: Permissions
Permissions.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute.  Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644).  You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.

Group.name: Group
Group.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute.  You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.

relationships.name: failure
relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure

relationships.name: merged
relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content

relationships.name: original
relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle

Merge Strategy.name: Merge Strategy
Merge Strategy.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles

allowableValue.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

Merge Format.name: Merge Format
Merge Format.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.

allowableValue.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile
The Avro contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

Attribute Strategy.name: Attribute Strategy
Attribute Strategy.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.

allowableValue.description: Any attribute that is not the same on all FlowFiles in a bin will be dropped. Those that are the same across all FlowFiles will be retained.

Any attribute that has the same value for all FlowFiles in a bin, or has no value for a FlowFile, will be kept. For example, if a bin consists of 3 FlowFiles and 2 of them have a value of 'hello' for the 'greeting' attribute and the third FlowFile has no 'greeting' attribute then the outbound FlowFile will get a 'greeting' attribute with the value 'hello'.

Correlation Attribute Name.name: Correlation Attribute Name
Correlation Attribute Name.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.

mergecontent-metadata-strategy.name: mergecontent-metadata-strategy
mergecontent-metadata-strategy.description: For FlowFiles whose input format supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), this property determines which metadata should be added to the bundle. If 'Use First Metadata' is selected, the metadata keys/values from the first FlowFile to be bundled will be used. If 'Keep Only Common Metadata' is selected, only the metadata that exists on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved. If 'Ignore Metadata' is selected, no metadata is transferred to the outgoing bundled FlowFile. If 'Do Not Merge Uncommon Metadata' is selected, any FlowFile whose metadata values do not match those of the first bundled FlowFile will not be merged.

allowableValue.description: For any input format that supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), the metadata for the first FlowFile in the bin will be set on the output FlowFile.

For any input format that supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), any FlowFile whose metadata values match those of the first FlowFile, any additional metadata will be dropped but the FlowFile will be merged. Any FlowFile whose metadata values do not match those of the first FlowFile in the bin will not be merged.
For any input format that supports metadata (Avro, e.g.), any FlowFile whose metadata values do not match those of the first FlowFile in the bin will not be merged.
Ignores (does not transfer, compare, etc.) any metadata from a FlowFile whose content supports embedded metadata.

Maximum Number of Entries.name: Maximum Number of Entries
Maximum Number of Entries.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle

Maximum Group Size.name: Maximum Group Size
Maximum Group Size.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.

Max Bin Age.name: Max Bin Age
Max Bin Age.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours

Maximum number of Bins.name: Maximum number of Bins
Maximum number of Bins.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time

Delimiter Strategy.name: Delimiter Strategy
Delimiter Strategy.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.

allowableValue.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

Header File.name: Header File
Header File.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.

Footer File.name: Footer File
Footer File.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.

Demarcator File.name: Demarcator File
Demarcator File.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.

Compression Level.name: Compression Level
Compression Level.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored

Keep Path.name: Keep Path
Keep Path.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored

Tar Modified Time.name: Tar Modified Time
Tar Modified Time.description: If using the Tar Merge Format, specifies if the Tar entry should store the modified timestamp either by expression (e.g. ${file.lastModifiedTime} or static value, both of which must match the ISO8601 format 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ'; if using other merge strategy or left blank, this value is ignored

allowableValue.description: Yield the processor so that another attempt to obtain the high-water mark can be made later.

Penalize the flow file and return it to the queue that it came from so that another attempt to obtain the high-water mark can be made later.  Behaves the same as "Yield" if this processor is the first one in the flow.
Route immediately to the "activeFailure" relationship.

allowableValue.description: Routes the flow file to the "activeFailure" relationship

Max Yield Count.name: Max Yield Count
Max Yield Count.description: The maximum number of yields/penalizations, if the yield strategy is selected, that should be attempted before failures to obtain a high-water mark are handled according to the "Max Yield Count Strategy" setting (handling never occurs if unset or less than zero)
